basics.name: Dan Spector
basics.label: Front-end developer, data visualization designer, writer
basics.summary: I’m a developer, designer, and writer. I just graduated with a master’s degree in information design and data visualization from Northeastern University. I enjoy making graphics and interactives to explain concepts and data. Most of my work utilizes HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like D3 and React. I’m looking for a job as a web developer and am flexible enough to adapt to a variety of roles.

work.summary: I created visual, data-driven applications in a studio environment as part of my graduate studies.
highlights: Tackled design challenges through individual and team project work
Produced an interactive data visualization about why the U.S. should eliminate the penny for my master's thesis
Visualized the American craft beer industry from a geographic perspective

work.summary: I produced video and social media content for a company promoting women’s corporate leadership development.
highlights: Crafted a speaker reel for the CEO, spending months iterating and revising footage
Edited video from conferences about women in the workplace issues and female executive career growth
Revamped company marketing strategy on social media

work.summary: I served as a circulation assistant at a busy suburban library. I also headed all marketing and information initiatives for the library website.
highlights: Assisted patrons with book checkout in an efficient and organized manner
Curated library website with programming information and author bios
Wrote articles detailing local happenings in the library community
